com.brownian.morse

Class BufferedMorseReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brownian.morse.MorseToMidiReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MorseReceiver

    public class BufferedMorseReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements MorseReceiver
    A class that receives Morse symbols, translates them to MIDI instructions, and passes those to a MIDI Receiver (on Channel 0). This class is not thread-safe; if receiving from multiple sources, symbols should be sent to it inside synchronized blocks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferedMorseReceiver(javax.sound.midi.Receiver midiReceiver)
      Creates a receiver that accepts Morse symbols and generates MIDI instructions for the given MIDI receiver.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferedMorseReceiver

        public BufferedMorseReceiver(javax.sound.midi.Receiver midiReceiver)
        Creates a receiver that accepts Morse symbols and generates MIDI instructions for the given MIDI receiver. These MIDI sounds are played as soon as Morse symbols are received.
        Parameters:
        midiReceiver - the MIDI receiver for this object to control

    • Method Detail

      • getReceiver

        @NotNull
public static BufferedMorseReceiver getReceiver()
                                                   throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
        A factory method that generates a BufferedMorseReceiver connected to the default MIDI Receiver.
        Returns:
        A BufferedMorseReceiver that sends MIDI commands describing received Morse code to a MIDI receiver.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if MIDI could not be loaded
        See Also:
        MidiSystem.getReceiver()
